2.speaker: voice
2.english: We are currently conducting a phone survey.

3.speaker: voice
3.japanese: 自動音声に従って質問にお答えください
3.english: Please give your answers after the automated questions.

4.speaker: polar bear
4.japanese: あなたは 最近寝不足でお悩みですか
4.english: Have you been suffering from a lack of sleep lately?

5.speaker: grizzly
5.english: I know it's you, Polar Bear!

7.speaker: polar bear
7.japanese: この前 起きたばかりなのにまた寝てるの
7.english: You just woke up recently, and you're asleep again?

8.speaker: grizzly
8.japanese: ああ 冬眠の二度寝だ
8.english: Yeah, I went back to bed to hibernate.

9.speaker: polar bear
9.japanese: 二度寝じゃないでしょ

10.speaker: polar bear
10.japanese: もう八度寝くらいだよ
10.english: You've gone back about eight times.

11.speaker: grizzly
11.japanese: お前が 何度も起こすからだろ
11.english: Because you keep waking me up!

14.speaker: grizzly
14.english: You really need to... ...stop that, damn it!

17.speaker: grizzly mama
17.japanese: もう 乱暴な言葉遣いはおよしなさい
17.english: You really need to stop with the harsh speech.

18.speaker: grizzly mama
18.english: Here, I brought you a gift. I-I always tell you to let me know when you're coming.

22.speaker: grizzly
22.japanese: グリちゃんはいい加減やめてくれよ
22.english: I asked you not to call me that anymore. Maple syrup and Alaskan salmon!

26.speaker: grizzly mama
26.japanese: やっぱり 我が家は落ち着くわね
26.english: Being at home really is relaxing.

27.speaker: grizzly mama
27.japanese: このまま住んじゃおうかしら

28.speaker: grizzly
28.japanese: 冗談だろ じいちゃんの生まれ故郷で
28.english: Please. You were the one who moved overseas,

29.speaker: grizzly
29.japanese: ロハスな田舎暮らしをするって海外移住したくせに
29.english: so you could have a LOHAS-style county life where grandpa was born.

30.speaker: grizzly mama
30.japanese: どう 本場のメープルシロップは
30.english: Well? How does the authentic maple syrup taste?

31.speaker: grizzly mama
31.japanese: 春に収穫した旬のものよ

33.speaker: grizzly mama
33.japanese: あら お客様かしらあ…
33.english: Oh? It looks like you've got a visitor. Oh, don't worry about it, Mom. I'll get it.

36.speaker: grizzly
36.japanese: それは 広島だろうが
36.english: That's Hiroshima! What are you up to {\i1}(nanimon){\i0}?!

37.speaker: grizzly
37.japanese: それは イロモンだ

39.speaker: grizzly mama
39.english: And this is for hot pot {\i1}(nabemono){\i0}! Hello, Polar Bear.

40.speaker: polar bear
40.japanese: あっ どうも ご無沙汰してます
40.english: Oh, hello. It's been a very long time.

41.speaker: baby emp
41.japanese: お花見電車が通過しま～す
41.english: The cherry blossom viewing train is coming through!

44.speaker: polar bear
44.japanese: 鍋ではなく ムニエルにしてみました
44.english: I made it meunière instead of in a hot pot.

46.speaker: panda mama
46.japanese: いいの 私たちまでいただいちゃって
46.english: Are you sure we can have some, as well?

47.speaker: grizzly mama
47.japanese: どうぞ めしあがってください

50.speaker: king
50.japanese: うん さすが本場産の天然物だわね
50.english: Nothing better than getting fish fresh from its natural habitat.

51.speaker: panda mama
51.japanese: それにしてもグリズリーさんのお母さんにしては
51.english: But, my, you seem rather young to be Mr. Grizzly's mother.

53.speaker: king
53.japanese: 失礼ですけど おいくつ
53.english: I hope you don't mind me asking, but how old are you?

54.speaker: grizzly mama
54.english: Oh? Well, this year... I'm seventeen.

56.speaker: panda mama
56.english: What? You don't look it at all!

59.speaker: king
59.japanese: 毛並みも艶やかで 若々しいわ
59.english: Your fur is so sleek and youthful!

60.speaker: panda mama
60.japanese: キューティクルの秘訣 教えてくださらない
60.english: Could you tell me your secret behind your cuticles?

61.speaker: grizzly mama
61.japanese: いえ 特別なことは何も
61.english: Oh, I don't do anything special, really.

62.speaker: king
62.japanese: あら 田中さん どうしたの
62.english: What's the matter, Ms. Tanaka? Oh... It's just I'm the oldest...

63.speaker: penguin
63.japanese: はじめまして ペンギンです
63.english: Nice to meet you. I'm Penguin.

64.speaker: panda
64.english: I'm Panda. I'm always taking care of Mr. Grizzly.

65.speaker: panda mama
65.japanese: 違うでしょ 「お世話になってます」でしょ
65.english: No, you mean that he's always taking care of you...

66.speaker: grizzly mama
66.japanese: はじめまして グリちゃんの母です
66.english: Nice to meet you. I'm Little Grizz's mother.

68.speaker: grizzly
68.japanese: 母さん余計なこと言うんじゃねえ

70.speaker: sasako
70.japanese: へえ～ グリちゃんですか

71.speaker: baby emp
71.japanese: ご乗車の方はお急ぎくださ～い
71.english: All passengers please hurry on board.

75.speaker: king
75.english: We'll come again. Thank you for the food.

77.speaker: grizzly
77.japanese: じゃあ 俺は店に行くから
77.english: Well, I'm going to the bar, so you can head home.

78.speaker: baby emp
78.japanese: じゃあ 俺は店に行くから

80.speaker: baby emp
80.english: {\a6}See you later! Do your best at work. Yeah.

81.speaker: grizzly
81.japanese: まったく 調子狂うぜ
81.english: Jeez... This is totally throwing things off.

82.speaker: grizzly
82.japanese: 久しぶりに打ってから行くか
82.english: Guess I'll knock a few out before I head in.

83.speaker: grizzly
83.japanese: ふぅ～ スッキリしたぜ
83.english: Man, that felt great! Sorry to leave you with the bar, Otter.

87.speaker: grizzly
87.japanese: 母さん なんでいるんだ

89.speaker: grizzly
89.japanese: カワウソ どういうことだ

90.speaker: otter
90.japanese: いやぁ 助かるでやんす
90.english: She's been a lot of help.

91.speaker: tiger
91.japanese: マスター 寝不足なんだって
91.english: I heard you're not sleeping well.

92.speaker: lion
92.japanese: 代わりに店に立ってくれるなんて

93.speaker: lion
93.japanese: いいおふくろさんじゃない
93.english: to help you with the bar.

94.speaker: wolf
94.japanese: ママ ふきのとうの春巻きおいしいよ
94.english: These fuki bud spring rolls are delicious.

96.speaker: tiger
96.japanese: ママ 助六寿司もうまいぜ
96.english: The inari and roll sushi plate is great, too.

98.speaker: lion
98.japanese: ママ 味噌汁おかわり
98.english: Could I get another miso soup?

100.speaker: lion
100.japanese: ただの味噌汁じゃねえよな

102.speaker: three
102.english: Mom! Who asked you to make healthy family cooking?

103.speaker: grizzly
103.japanese: うちは 小料理屋じゃねえ

105.speaker: grizzly mama
105.japanese: じゃあ マスターも来たし私は帰るわね
105.english: Well, the bar keep is back, so I'll head home.

106.speaker: grizzly mama
106.japanese: 皆さんこれからもグリズリーバーをごひいきに
106.english: Everyone, please keep visiting Grizzly's Bar.

113.speaker: aligator
113.japanese: たまにはこういう味もいいよね
113.english: This isn't bad once in a while.

115.speaker: otter
115.japanese: ママ ジンライムおかわりでやんす
115.english: Could I get another gin lime?

117.speaker: chin
117.japanese: このイワシの生姜煮  絶品だよ ママ

118.speaker: grizzly mama
118.japanese: ありがとうございます

119.speaker: donkey
119.japanese: だし巻き卵も美味ですね
119.english: The Japanese style omelettes are wonderful, too. Bar keep, this is the owner of the bakery I'm training at, Ms. Donkey.

121.speaker: wolf
121.japanese: 店長 これを使って和風の惣菜パンを作りませんか
121.english: Why don't we try to make a Japanese style bakery dish with these?

122.speaker: donkey
122.japanese: だし巻きサンド いいですね
122.english: Japanese style omelette sandwiches? Sounds great.

124.speaker: polar bear
124.japanese: スコッチ おかわり

125.speaker: penguin
125.japanese: グリちゃん シャンディガフ
125.english: Could I get another Shandygaff, Little Grizz?

126.speaker: panda
126.japanese: 笹ジュース グリちゃん
126.english: I want bamboo grass juice, Little Grizz.

128.speaker: sasako
128.japanese: カルーアミルクください グリちゃん
128.english: Could I get a Kahlua milk, Little Grizz? Even you, Sasako?!

129.speaker: grizzly
129.japanese: ったく しようがねえな
129.english: Damn it. Looks like I have no choice.

130.speaker: aligator
130.japanese: テキーラ グリちゃん

131.speaker: grizzly
131.english: I ain't going to let you get away with that!

134.speaker: grizzly mama
134.japanese: おやすみ グリちゃん

135.speaker: sasako
135.japanese: え タイムカプセルですか

136.speaker: llama
136.japanese: はい 昔 自分宛てに出した手紙が届きまして
136.english: Yes. I sent a letter to myself years ago, and it just arrived.

137.speaker: sasako
137.japanese: あっ もののけの森
137.english: Wow! The Mononoke Forest! You left a time capsule there? Yes.

138.speaker: penguin
138.japanese: なんで 笹子さんが知ってるの
138.english: How does Miss Sasako know about this?

139.speaker: polar bear
139.japanese: むかしむかし 昔笹子さんとラマさんは
139.english: Long, long ago... Miss Sasako and Mr. Llama lived in the same city.

140.speaker: penguin
140.japanese: なんで 昔ばなし風
140.english: Why are you saying it like an old folktale?

144.speaker: penguin
144.japanese: イントロクイズじゃないんだから
144.english: This isn't a song intro quiz!

145.speaker: sasako
145.japanese: ラマさん 何を埋めたんですか
145.english: What did you bury, Mr. Llama?

146.speaker: llama
146.japanese: それが もう覚えてなくて…
146.english: The thing is, I don't remember at all.

147.speaker: llama
147.japanese: 明日 掘り返しに行くので 何が出てくるか楽しみです
147.english: I'm going to go dig it up tomorrow, so it'll be exciting.

148.speaker: llama
148.japanese: シロクマさん お店はいいんですか
148.english: What about the café, Mr. Polar Bear? Don't worry. The Café's other name is the Fickle Café.

149.speaker: puppet
149.japanese: それ ダメな気まぐれですから

150.speaker: polar bear
150.japanese: 笹子さん ミクロ系になったね

151.speaker: polar bear
151.japanese: 略して ミクロ笹子さんだね
151.english: I guess shortened it'd be Micro Miss Sasako.

154.speaker: sasako
154.japanese: ペンギンさん やめてくれませんか
154.english: Could you stop that, Mr. Penguin?

155.speaker: penguin
155.japanese: なんで 昨日 徹夜してまで作ってきたのに
155.english: Why? Even though I stayed up all night making it?

156.speaker: panda
156.japanese: すごい 一夜づけだね

157.speaker: llama
157.japanese: ほめてませんね それ

164.speaker: polar bear
164.english: So the five of us are all here.

166.speaker: guy
166.japanese: 網棚で寝るパンダなんてレアだな
166.english: It's rare to see a panda sleeping in the luggage rack.

167.speaker: girl
167.japanese: ブログにアップしよう
167.english: I'm totally uploading this to my blog!

168.speaker: penguin
168.japanese: 網棚で寝るパンダが 検索ワードランキングで急上昇してるよ
168.english: Searches for "Panda sleeping in the luggage rack" is are spiking across the Internet.

169.speaker: polar bear
169.japanese: パンダ君をペンギンさんと回収してくるから
169.english: I'll go fetch Panda with Mr. Penguin,

170.speaker: polar bear
170.japanese: ラマさんと先に行ってて
170.english: so go on ahead with Mr. Llama.

171.speaker: sasako
171.japanese: はい じゃあ ラマさん…

172.speaker: llama
172.japanese: ベンチの下で寝るラマはいかがでしょう
172.english: How about a llama sleeping under a bench?

173.speaker: penguin
173.japanese: じゃあ 旅の記念に１枚
173.english: Well, I guess I'll take oneto remember it by.

176.speaker: llama
176.japanese: クリームパン 葉っぱの形は昔のまんまですね
176.english: Looks like the cream bread is still shaped like a leaf. Since we're here, how about we buy five of them? Five of them?

177.speaker: sasako
177.english: Enough for everyone! So the swings were this small...

178.speaker: llama
178.japanese: 昔は 僕も余裕で乗れたんですけどね
178.english: I used to be able to sit on it  without any problem, too.

179.speaker: sasako
179.japanese: どうやって乗ってたんですか
179.english: How did you sit on it?

180.speaker: llama
180.japanese: ご想像にお任せします
180.english: I'll leave that up to your imagination. Wow, that's amazing, Mr. Llama!

181.speaker: sasako
181.japanese: 昔も砂場が好きだったんですか

183.speaker: llama
183.japanese: いつの日か サグラダファミリアを造るのが目標です
183.english: My goal one day is to make the Sagrada Família. I see...

186.speaker: raccoon
186.japanese: ああ 浜の湯の裏に住んでた
186.english: Oh! The one that lived behind Hama no Yu.

188.speaker: raccoon
188.japanese: 迷子で有名な 笹子ちゃん
188.english: Sasako who was famous for getting lost!

189.speaker: sassako
189.english: Yes... Didn't you end up going over to the next city

190.speaker: raccoon
190.japanese: 隣町まで行っちゃったのよね
190.english: because you wanted to see the wind station's turbine up close?

192.speaker: raccoon
192.japanese: ちゃんとやってる アンタ放浪癖があるから
192.english: How ya been? You've always had a habit of wandering off

193.japanese: 昔から 心配してたのよ
193.english: so I always worried about you.

195.speaker: llama
195.japanese: どうも お久しぶりです

197.speaker: llama
197.japanese: いつも アライグマさんに怒られて

198.japanese: 洗い物をさせられた ラマです
198.english: always yell at and make help you clean.

201.speaker: llama
201.english: It's been a while. Well, haven't you calmed down a bit? I may not look it, but I'm an adult now.

202.speaker: raccoon
202.japanese: でも 落ち着きすぎて
202.english: But you've calmed down so much, you look rather dull now.

203.speaker: sasako
203.japanese: アライグマさんの毒舌 変わりませんね
203.english: Ms. Raccoon's sharp tongue hasn't changed.

205.speaker: llama
205.japanese: まるで 時間旅行で
205.english: It's as if we've time traveled back to the town from our memories.

206.speaker: sasako
206.japanese: ラマさんって ロマンチストなんですね

208.speaker: polar bear
208.japanese: 笹子さん どこにいるの

209.speaker: polar bear
209.japanese: なかなか来ないから お風呂に入っちゃったよ
209.english: You were taking a while, so we decided to take a bath.

211.speaker: penguin
211.japanese: たまにはあったかいお風呂もいいよね
211.english: A hot bath is great once in a while.

212.speaker: polar bear
212.japanese: 笹子さん なつかしいでしょ

213.speaker: polar bear
213.japanese: ひとっ風呂 浴びてきなよ
213.english: Why don't you have a quick bath? No, I'm fine...

214.speaker: penguin
214.japanese: 結局 何を埋めたか思い出せないまま
214.english: So you still can't remember what you buried?

216.speaker: sasako
216.english: Maybe it was a clay figure.

217.speaker: penguin
217.japanese: ハズレに１万トゥグルグ賭けるよ
217.english: I bet 10,000 tugrik that it's not.

219.speaker: penguin
219.english: I think they might have expired...

221.speaker: penguin
221.english: You're thinking of Tokugawa. My heart is beating fast.

222.speaker: sasako
222.japanese: みんな もうすぐですよ

223.speaker: sasako
223.japanese: そこの角を曲がれば もののけの森です
223.english: As soon as we turn the corner... It's the Mononoke Forest.

224.speaker: penguin
224.japanese: これじゃあ タイムカプセルは掘り返せないね
224.english: Probably not going to be able to dig up the time capsule now.

225.speaker: sasako
225.japanese: 一本杉だけ残したんですね
225.english: Looks like they left the cedar.

226.speaker: llama
226.japanese: あの下に埋めたんですが

230.speaker: polar bear
230.japanese: 素朴な味わいがいいね
230.english: The simplicity of the taste is great.

231.speaker: sasako
231.japanese: カスタードクリームがたっぷりでしょ
231.english: There's a lot of custard cream in it, isn't there?

232.speaker: llama
232.english: The taste hasn't changed at all.

233.speaker: panda
233.japanese: なに スーパーマン

235.speaker: sasako
235.japanese: ほら あそこに風車が見えるでしょ
235.english: Look. You can see the windmill, right?

236.speaker: sasako
236.japanese: あれ 思い出の風車なんだよ
236.english: That's a very memorable windmill to me.

237.speaker: penguin
237.japanese: ラマさん 残念だったね
237.english: It's too bad though, Mr. Llama.

239.speaker: llama
239.japanese: でも 久しぶりにこの町に来られたので よかったです
239.english: But it was great just being able to come back here.

242.speaker: badger
242.japanese: どうも 遅くなりました
242.english: Hello! Sorry for taking so long.

243.speaker: polar bear
243.japanese: 頼むね アナグマ君

244.speaker: badger
244.japanese: 穴掘りなら任せてください

246.speaker: llama
246.japanese: よろしくお願いします

249.speaker: polar bear
249.japanese: 出た 徳川の埋蔵金
249.english: Did you find it? Tokugawa's buried treasure?

250.speaker: penguin
250.japanese: 埋蔵金だったら 糸井さんが悔しがると思うな
250.english: I'm sure Mr. Itoi would be disappointed if it was found.

252.speaker: panda
252.japanese: イトイさん ミズノさん

253.speaker: sasako
253.japanese: パンダ君 いらない知識だよ

256.speaker: sasako
256.japanese: 何が入ってるんでしょうね

260.speaker: polar bear
260.japanese: 今が旬の アミガサタケのクリームパスタ どうぞ
260.english: Here's some pasta with cream sauce, with seasonal mushrooms. Eat up.

261.speaker: badger
261.japanese: キノコ大好きです いただきます
261.english: I love mushrooms! Thank you for the food!

263.speaker: penguin
263.japanese: 志ん生だよ きっと

266.speaker: llama
266.japanese: 聴いてみての お楽しみです
266.english: We'll just have to listen and see.

267.speaker: sasako
267.japanese: シロクマさん これですか
267.english: Is this it, Mr. Polar Bear?

268.speaker: polar bear
268.japanese: ありがとう よく見つけたね
268.english: Thanks. I'm surprised you found it.

269.speaker: polar bear
269.japanese: じゃあ 再生するよ

270.speaker: llama
270.japanese: 「ラマママ リャママラミャ ラッミャママミャラマンボー」
270.english: {\a6}Llama ma ma, llama ma ma, llama ma ma ma... {\a6}Llamambo! {\a6}Llama ma ma, llama ma ma, llama ma ma ma...

272.speaker: llama
272.japanese: 僕が作詞作曲しました
272.english: It's a song I wrote. They called me the Third Avenue Mozart when I was a kid.

274.speaker: penguin
274.japanese: シロクマ君 カフェモカおかわり
274.english: Could I get another café mocha, Polar Bear?

275.speaker: panda
275.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

277.speaker: panda
277.japanese: 僕のかわいいに いつ補償金が出るかな
277.english: When do you think I'll get a subsidy for my cuteness?

278.speaker: penguin
278.japanese: たぶんぜっと出ないかな

279.speaker: panda
279.japanese: じゃあ二百円あげるから二万円ちょうだい
279.english: Okay, then I'll give you 200 yen, so could you give me 20,000 yen in return?

280.speaker: penguin
280.japanese: その取り引きでyesと言う地球人はたぶんいないかな
280.english: I don't think anyone on Earth would say yes to that trade.

281.speaker: sasako
281.japanese: お汁粉とぜんざいで何が違うですか
281.english: How are red bean soup and red-bean soup different? We can discuss that later.

282.speaker: penguin
282.japanese: シロクマくん 終ろ

283.speaker: polar bear
283.japanese: 来週のシロクマカフェイ二十四時は
283.english: Next week's Polar Bear Café 24 o'clock...

284.speaker: penguin
284.japanese: 最終回も普通に予告しないんだね
284.english: Not gonna even announce the last episode correctly, huh?
